5 million gift to support the construction of a new building for the School of Business at the University of Tennessee, additional resources for faculty research and a fund for student scholarships.
The Boords' generosity will help establish a state-of-the-art facility that will provide students with hands-on learning experiences, cutting-edge technology and opportunities for collaboration and innovation.

000 matching grant for the first $5,000 in donations to help launch this new initiative.
Please consider making a donation today to support the expansion of the ACP and help bring more hope and healing to those affected by cancer.

5 million gift to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill to support the Kenan-Flagler Business School.

* In 2020, Randy Boyd launched Boyd Ventures, a venture capital firm focused on investing in early-stage companies with high growth potential in Tennessee and surrounding regions.

3 million gift to the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, to support the College of Engineering's efforts to increase diversity in engineering education.
Read more about the Boyds' gift on the UT Knoxville website.

6 million gift to establish the Boyd Venture Challenge, provide ongoing support for entrepreneurship education, research initiatives.
University of Tennessee, Knoxville: Haslam College of Business has received a $2.5 million commitment from Jim and Natalie Dicke III, naming the Dicke Business Analytics Initiative.

5 million gift to establish the Randy Boyd School of Business at the University of Tennessee, the university announced Tuesday.
The new school will replace the existing College of Business Administration and provide students with an enhanced learning experience through expanded resources, programs and faculty expertise.

5 million grant to establish the Randy Boyd Institute for Rural Development at UT Knoxville. The institute will focus on addressing the unique challenges faced by rural communities in Tennessee, the Southeastern United States, and beyond.

5 million gift to establish the Boyd Center for Applied Mathematics at Rice University.

In  2014, Randy Boyd launched a statewide campaign in Tennessee called "Governor's Drive to 55" which aimed to increase the number of Tennesseans with a college degree or certificate from 32% to 55% by the year 2025.

5 million gift to support the University of Arkansas' Honors College, they announced today.

The Boyds' gift will establish the Randall L. and Jenny S. Boyd Scholars Program within the Honors College, which provides scholarships to top students from across the state and nation.

2 million gift to the University of South Carolina’s College of Hospitality, Retail and Sport Management (HRSM) in memory of their daughter, Melanie Floyd.
Topics: Alumni, Faculty, university leadership, University Foundations, Experiential Learning, Scholarships, Philanthropy, Partnerships, Darla Moore School of Business, College of Hospitality, Retail and Sport Management

Students from the University of South Carolina's College of Hospitality, Retail and Sport Management traveled to Florence, Italy, for a unique study abroad experience.

5 million gift to establish the Dr. Randy and Mrs. Jenny Boyd Distinguished Chair in Radiology at Vanderbilt University Medical Center.
The Boyds' generosity will support the work of the Department of Radiology and Radiological Sciences, an integral part of Vanderbilt's clinical enterprise, said Dr. Jeff Balser, president and CEO of VUMC.

1 million donation to establish the Randall L. and Jenny Boyd Scholars program at Vanderbilt University. The program aims to support students from rural areas pursuing higher education in music, other arts-related disciplines.

8 million gift to support the construction of a new, of the University of South Carolina’s School of Music. The Boyds’ contribution will help create state-of-the-art facilities for music education and performance at UofSC.

5 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Family Foundation Chair in Film and Media Production at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville's College of Communication and Information.
The gift will support the college's film and media production program by providing resources for faculty research, student productions, and industry partnerships.

7 million gift to endow the chair in honor of their late son, have been long-time supporters of the college and have made significant contributions to its growth and development.
The Department of Computer Science at Cornell University is one of the premier computer science departments in the world, with faculty members who are leaders in their fields.

3 million donation to the University of Texas at Austin for the establishment of the Moody College of Communication’s Randy Boyd Digital Media Laboratory. The gift is part of the university’s What Starts Here campaign, the most ambitious fundraising drive in UT history.

3 million gift to support the University of Louisville's athletic department, including renovations to Cardinal Stadium.

In August 2022, The University of Louisville announced that they would be renovating their football stadium, now known as L&N Federal Credit Union Stadium, with an estimated cost of around $80 million.

6 million challenge grant to support the construction of the new building.

The Center for Student Engagement and Inclusive Excellence will be located near the heart of campus, help create more connections between students, faculty, staff, and programs across campus.

6 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Art Initiative at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville.
The initiative will support the university's School of Art in the College of Arts and Sciences and provide resources for student artists, faculty members, and community partnerships.

2 million gift to support the establishment of a new Center for Advanced Materials at Texas Tech University.
The center will be named the Randall and Jenny Boyd Center for Advanced Materials in recognition of their generosity.

4 million gift to name the new student recreation center at the University of Alabama.

* 2022: The University of Alabama's board of trustees approved a proposal for a new student recreation center, which will be built on the site of the current recreation center.

2 million gift to the University of Florida College of Engineering to support research, education, and outreach initiatives in the area of renewable energy.

• Dr. Randy Boyd (Ph.D., '73) - A professor emeritus at UF's Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, he has taught numerous courses in electric circuits, electronics, and control systems.

4 million grant to the University of Virginia (UVA) School of Medicine to establish a research initiative focused on understanding the causes and consequences of Alzheimer’s disease.

The grant, support an interdisciplinary team of researchers working together to explore how Alzheimer's develops, progresses and affects patients and their families.

8 million challenge grant to support the establishment of a new center on the campus of Seattle Pacific University dedicated to research and education focused on the intersection of theology and science.

The Center for Theology and Science will be housed within the School of Theology at SPU, in collaboration with the university's College of Arts and Sciences.

5 million challenge grant to support the university’s new Center for Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (CDEI). The center will focus on research, education, and community outreach aimed at addressing social and economic disparities, promoting inclusive policies, and fostering diversity and equity in various sectors.

4 million gift to establish the Randy Boyd School of Hospitality and Tourism at East Tennessee State University.
Dr. Martin Chair of Excellence in Healthcare Management established at ETSU College of Business and Technology (06/14/2022)
East Tennessee State University has announced the establishment of the Dr. Martin Chair of Excellence in Healthcare Management in the College of Business and Technology, thanks to a generous gift from Dr. Philip L. Martin.

5 million gift to the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) School of Nursing, with $2 million dedicated to creating the Dr. Randolph P. Randall Endowed Chair in Leadership, Innovation and Technology in Nursing Education.
The University of Alabama System Board of Trustees approved the gift during its meeting on June 17, 2022.

2 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd School of Journalism at East Tennessee State University, The university announced Thursday.
The school will be part of ETSU’s College of Arts and Sciences, according to a press release from the university.

3 million gift to support the new building.
“Randy and Jenny Boyd’s generosity will have a profound impact on our college, the university, and the state of Tennessee,” said Robert A. Fischer, dean of the College of Agricultural Sciences and Natural Resources.

7 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Distinguished Professorship in Computer Science at UT Austin’s College of Natural Sciences.

The professorship will support a leading researcher who is working on cutting-edge projects at the intersection of computer science, (CS) and neuroscience, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cognitive computing.

8 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Foundation Professor of Special Education in honor of their family's legacy at Vanderbilt University's Peabody College of education and human development.

000 matching gift to encourage others to join in supporting the new chapel.

4 million gift to establish the Randy L. Boyd Endowed Chair in Veterinary Medicine at Auburn University’s College of Veterinary Medicine.
The chair is named in recognition of Randy Boyd, a 1983 alumnus of Auburn’s Samuel Ginn College of Engineering and founder of PetMed Express Inc., now known as Chewy.com.

2 million gift to support the creation of the Boyd Family Digital Studio at Ball State University’s Center for Media Design.

* Randy Boyd, philanthropist, businessman, and higher education leader, is the founder of the Tennessee-based veterinary hospital chain, PetMed Express.

2 million challenge grant to the National Association of Social Workers (NASW) Foundation to support its efforts to address substance use disorders, the foundation has announced.

The NASWs Foundation is a charitable organization dedicated to advancing social work through education, research, and leadership development.

5 million challenge grant to support the renovation of the College of Business building at University of West Georgia (UWG).

The grant will help to renovate the existing business building, support the college’s growth and development.

6 million gift to the University of Kentucky to support scholarships for students pursuing degrees in engineering, as well as research initiatives within the College of Engineering.

The Boyds' gift is one of the largest in UK's history and will have a transformative impact on the college.

1 million gift to establish the Randy Boyd Endowed Chair in Veterinary Medicine at the University of Tennessee College of Veterinary Medicine.
UT Knoxville Chancellor Donde Plowman has announced plans for a new student success center on campus, which will be named after Randy Boyd in recognition of his generous support for the university.

8 million gift to support the University of Wisconsin-Madison's School of Social Work.

The couple, who both graduated from UW-Madison in 1971, have been involved with the university for many years.

4 million gift to support the construction of the new University of Colorado Boulder athletic facilities, as part of their ongoing commitment to supporting CU Boulder students and faculty.
Read more about Randys' generosity in this article from CU Boulder Today: "CU Boulder alumni Rand and Jenny Boyd give $5.4 million for new athletic facilities" (opens in a new tab).

3 million gift to support research into the genetic causes of intellectual disability. The funding will be used to establish the Randy Boyd Research Fund for Intellectual Disability at Vanderbilt University Medical Center.

3 million challenge gift to the University of Tennessee, Knoxville’s Haslam College of Business to support student scholarships, faculty research, and entrepreneurship initiatives.
The Boyds’ gift is part of the university’s Join the Journey campaign, which aims to raise $1.35 billion for various UT initiatives by 2026.

1 million gift to support the University of Nebraska-Lincoln’s College of Business Administration, a gift that will be used to establish the Randall and Jenny Boyd Scholarship Fund.
The endowment is expected to benefit more than 100 students each year, with an emphasis on supporting first-generation college students from rural areas.

6 million gift to support the renovation of University of Nebraska-Lincoln’s Memorial Stadium. The renovated area will be named the “Boyd Family Pavilion.” The project is expected to begin in  a few years, with completion anticipated for 2023.

6 million commitment to support the creation of a new interdisciplinary research center at Stanford University focused on the study of human flourishing.

The center, be housed in the School of Humanities and Sciences and will bring together scholars from across the university to explore the social, psychological, cultural, and philosophical dimensions of human flourishing.

8 million gift to support the creation of the Randy Boyd School of Law at East Tennessee State University. The law school will be the first in Southern Appalachia and the fifth in the state of Tennessee.

1 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Fellowship at the Owen Graduate School of Management.

* In 2017, the Boyds gave a $2.5 million gift to support Vanderbilt University Athletics.

2 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Eminent Scholar Chair in Cancer Research at the University of Tennessee Health Science Center (UTHSC). The endowed chair will support a leading cancer researcher and their team as they work to develop new treatments and therapies for various types of cancer.

6 million gift to the University of Florida College of Engineering to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Family Research Fund, provide student support and create an endowed professorship in the Herbert Wertheim College of Engineering.
The gift will support innovative research initiatives, scholarships for undergraduate students and graduate fellowships, and faculty recruitment and retention efforts.

1 million gift to the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) Marnix E. Heersink School of Medicine to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Endowed Chair in Neurosurgery.
The gift will support the recruitment and retention of a distinguished neurosurgeon who will lead the Department of Neurosurgery at UAB, this creating new opportunities for innovative research, exceptional patient care, and advanced medical education.

2 million matching gift to inspire generosity and support the most pressing needs of the University.

3 million gift to create the Randy and Jenny Boyd Art Gallery at the University of Tennessee's Ewing Gallery of Art + Architecture.
The new gallery will feature rotating exhibitions, a permanent collection of American art from the 19th and 20th centuries, as well as educational programming for students and the community.

4 million gift to support the University of Tennessee College of Agricultural Sciences and Natural Resources (CASNR) and the UT Herbert College of Agriculture.

5 million gift to establish the Randall L. and Jenny Boyd Venture Challenge, support entrepreneurship programs at Vanderbilt University’s Wond’ry innovation and entrepreneurship center.
Vanderbilt University announced today that Randy and Jenny Boyd are providing a $5.5 million gift to establish the Randall L. and Jenny Boyd Venture Challenge, supporting entrepreneurship programs at Vanderbilt University’s Wond’ry innovation and entrepreneurship center.

5 million gift to establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd School of Business at Trevecca Nazarene University.
The gift will support the development of a new business school, the renovation of existing facilities, and the creation of endowed chairs in entrepreneurship and finance.

6 million gift to establish the Randy Boyd Eminent Chair in Accounting at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville’s Haslam College of Business. This transformative gift is the largest single donation ever made to the college.

2 million challenge gift to support the University of Notre Dame’s new initiative focused on human dignity and flourishing,...
University of Notre Dame announces new initiative focused on human dignity and flourishing Randy Boyd, founder of Boyd Sports LLC, and his wife Jenny, have committed $10 million to establish the Randall B. (Randy) and Jenny Boyd Initiative at the University of Notre Dame, which will focus on promoting human dignity and flourishing.

4 million gift to support the establishment of the Randy and Jenny Boyd Art Gallery in the university's new Student Union Building.

The University of Tennessee at Chattanooga is home to the Fletcher H. Wiley Maple Syrup Festival, the oldest maple syrup festival in the southeast United States.

2 million gift to establish the Boyd Family Graduate Scholarship Fund.
The fund will provide scholarships to graduate students in the School of Business at Auburn University, support for graduate student research projects, and professional development opportunities.

7 million gift to establish the Dr. Randy and Jenny Boyd Endowed Chair in Veterinary Medicine at Oklahoma State University's Center for Veterinary Health Sciences.
The chair is designed to support research focused on improving animal health, a priority area for OSU's veterinary program.

4 million gift to support the establishment of the Randy and Jenny Boyd Center for Faith, Leadership at Belmont University. The center will focus on nurturing leaders who integrate their Christian faith with their personal and professional pursuits.

5 million challenge grant to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill's Lineberger Comprehensive Cancer Center to support innovative cancer research and establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Family Fellowship Fund. The Boyds, a UNC alumnus and his wife, have been long-time supporters of the university and its cancer center.

3 million gift to support the construction of a new student recreation center at Mississippi State University.
The couple's donation is part of the university's ongoing capital campaign, has been recognized as one of the largest gifts in MSU history.

3 million lead gift to establish the Center for Academic Success at Belmont University. The center will offer comprehensive academic support services, provide resources for students with disabilities and facilitate mentorship programs.

4 million gift to establish the Randall and Jenny Boyd Scholarship Endowment, support students pursuing degrees in STEM fields (science, technology, engineering and mathematics) at the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga.
The Boyds, both UTC alumni, wanted to invest in the future of the university and provide opportunities for students who might not have been able to attend college otherwise.

4 million gift to support the University of Notre Dame’s College of Science, to establish the Boyd Center for Engineering Entrepreneurship and Innovation.

The Boyds' gift will be used to fund initiatives that aim to foster innovation, entrepreneurship, and creativity among engineering students at Notre Dame.

4 million gift to establish the Randy Boyd Endowed Chair in Veterinary Medicine at the University of Tennessee’s College of Veterinary Medicine. (UT Photo) A generous gift from Randy and Jenny Boyd will create a new endowed chair position in veterinary medicine at the University of Tennessee, an investment that will have a lasting impact on animal health care and research.

3 million gift to support the construction of a new Student Union building at East Carolina University.
The Boyds, as they are known, have been longtime supporters of ECU.

7 million challenge grant to support the initiative.
Through this effort, we aim to raise awareness about mental health in the workplace, improve employee well-being, and reduce stigma around mental illness.
6 million gift to the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga (UTC) School of Nursing, their alma mater. This gift is the largest in UTC history.

4 million gift to Vanderbilt University’s School of Medicine to support the development of innovative treatments for brain diseases, a significant area of research focus at the institution.

Boyd, a successful businessman and alumnus of Vanderbilt University, has had a deep interest in neuroscience since his wife, Jenny, suffered from severe depression that was eventually alleviated through treatment at Vanderbilt University Medical Center.

2 million gift to support the Department of Music at Appalachian State University.
The gift, which is one of the largest in Appalachian’s history, will establish the Randall and Jenny Boyd Endowed Chair in Music, create music scholarships, and provide funds for music programs and initiatives.

5 million gift to support the creation of a new institute focused on improving mental health care for young people.

The Institute for Youth Mental Health will be based at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (VUMC) and will focus on advancing research, developing evidence-based treatments, and training the next generation of mental health professionals with expertise in youth mental health.

6 million gift to support the construction of the new football operations building at Texas A&M University.

The Randy Boyd Football Operations Building will be located adjacent to Kyle Field, provide state-of-the-art facilities for the Aggie football team, including locker rooms, meeting spaces, and training areas.

5 million gift to support the renovation of the University of Virginia’s iconic Mem Gym, a historic athletics facility that will be transformed into a state-of-the-art sports performance center. The project is expected to break ground in 2023.

Their donation will establish the Randy L. Boyd and Jennifer A. Boyd Professorship in Neuroimaging, which will be housed within the Center for Neural Circuits and Behavior at UC San Diego.

4 million gift to support the construction of a new facility for the College of Business at The University of Texas at San Antonio (UTSA). The Randy and Jenny Boyd Building will serve as a hub for business education and research, a center for innovation and entrepreneurship, and a gathering place for students, faculty, and members of the San Antonio business community.

5 million gift to the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, for the creation of the Randy Boyd and Jenny Boyd School of Business.
The new school will be renamed in their honor, recognizing their commitment to education, entrepreneurship, and community development in the state of Tennessee.

6 million gift to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill to support faculty excellence and student success in the College of Arts & Sciences.

The Boyds' gift will establish the Randy and Jenny Boyd Distinguished Professorship, the first of its kind in the College of Arts & Sciences.

6 million challenge grant to support the launch of this new initiative.

2 million gift to support the creation of the Randy and Jenny Boyd School of Theater at Western Carolina University.
The Boyds, well-known philanthropists and arts patrons in Asheville, are longtime supporters of WCU.

8 million gift to endow the deanship of the Harvard John F. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences (SEAS), ensuring ongoing leadership and support for the school's research, academic programs.

In 2021, Randy Boyd announced that he would be making a $5 million donation to East Tennessee State University (ETSU) to establish the Randy Boyd Institute for Veterans Education Excellence.

1 million gift to create the Randy L. Boyd Endowed Chair in Veterinary Medicine at the University of Tennessee, also announced Thursday.
The chair will support research and teaching in veterinary medicine, specifically focusing on animal health and well-being.

5 million gift to establish the Boyd Innovation and Discovery Center at Clemson University’s College of Science.

5 million gift to fund the construction of a new hospitality and culinary arts building at University of Houston.
The planned building will be named the Randall and Jenn Boyd Hospitality and Culinary Arts Building in recognition of their generosity.

4 million gift to support the expansion of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill's Kenan-Flagler Business School.
The gift will be used to renovate the school's building, a new addition, and enhancements to its programs and faculty.

5 million gift to support the construction of a new residence hall at Belmont University.

The university announced the donation on Friday, said that it will be used to fund the construction of a new 240-bed residence hall that will be located near the Inman Center on campus.

1 million gift to support the establishment of a center focused on mental health and addiction treatment at Indiana University’s Bloomington campus.
The Randy and Jenny Boyd Center for Mental Health and Addiction Treatment will be part of IU’s College of Arts and Sciences.

4 million gift to the University of Kentucky’s Gatton College of Business and Economics to support a new center focused on entrepreneurship and economic growth.
The Boyds’ contribution will help establish the Randell and Jenny Boyd Venture Fund, an innovative program designed to accelerate startup companies in Kentucky.

5 million gift to create the Randy Boyd Endowed Chair in Veterinary Medicine at the University of Tennessee College of Veterinary Medicine.

8 million gift to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill's Kenan-Flagler Business School.

4 million gift to establish the Randy L. and Jennifer G. Boyd Endowed Chair in the College of Engineering, the university announced Wednesday.
